alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver; Washington (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shippingport, or 8 miles southwest of Aliquippa, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Shaler Township, North Side Pittsburgh, Upper St. Clair, Hampton Township, Scott Township, Robinson Township, Economy, Dormont, Bellevue, Castle Shannon, Carnegie, and Kennedy Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 55 and 73. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 42 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western and southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
